ratings.comment: Professor Keller's lectures are amazing and were honestly the best part of my week. She is extremely caring and willing to help you. However, there is a lot of reading and if you do not genuinely enjoy literature you will not enjoy this class. If you aren't looking for a challenge and just something to satisfy comm B I would go with something else.

Prof. Keller's lectures are an absolute bore and she expects everyone to have the same amount of passion for her class as she does (even though most people are just in it for satisfying a com b). Also if you dont want to read 50-60 pages a night, turn back now.
Lectures are actually interesting and the required novels/short readings are very interesting.

Took this class for Comm B and lit credit. Obviously it is a lot of reading if it fulfills those two things. Lecture did get boring, but if literally all you did was read, attend lecture, and spend at least three good hours on both papers you should be fine in the class. Overall it made me think, and I enjoyed it.

Go to class, get the attendance grade. Read the material. Give up half way through. Decide to buy audible. Hate yourself because you spent your weekends reading and not getting lit. Pass because you attended lecture.
Typical literature class. Lots of reading and lots of analyzing particular texts and specific passages, words, or sentences.

Her classes are long and boring, and there is an insane amount of reading assignments. She also takes lecture time to preach about her personal political beliefs, this semester specifically involving the Ferguson debates. It is hard to get anything other than a B on anything. Hope for a good TA. Do not take just for com B, take something better.

I see many neutralnegative reviews for 100-level courses. I'd assume those are from freshman. Literary analysis is a skill set many freshman haven't yet honed; my last paper I got an "A" even though her first comment was that she disagreed with what I was arguing. She expects quality work, but she's more than open to your own interpretations.

Professor Keller is a really nice lady but her lectures are boring and she doesn't keep up with her power point slides which is frustrating. There is a ton of reading and most of the books aren't very interesting. She also takes attendance for both lecture and discussion.

She's nice and loves what she does, but if you don't like literary analysis you won't like this class. She takes attendance in lecture, and discussion, but it's an easy grade booster just to be there. There was a lot of reading and not all of it was wonderful. She's a great teacher to learn from but be interested in the subject or you'll be bored.

Professor Keller has a heart of gold, but she is very eccentric and frankly the lectures are hard to listen to. There is an excessive amount of reading, which is to be expected of a lit class, but the books were dry and painful with the exception of the final one, Oryx and Crake. She takes attendance during lecture.
Lots of reading and your grade is almost entirely based on the midterm papers. It's hard to get an A, but if you're creative and love writing, not impossible.

Keller is crazy, her class was really obnoxious. I took a FIG with her class as the "central class" but I really wasn't interested in the subject matter at all. If you can avoid having her, I'd highly recommend that.

She is a really nice lady that loves teaching, but if you don't like literary analysis the lectures will be boring. To make matters worse, she takes attendance each lecture, and an absence is half a letter grade off.

Keller's lectures can get a bit tedious, but that isn't for her lack of enthusiasm. Personally, I just didn't like most of the books. She's willing to take questions but doesn't always give the answer you're looking for. Grading is based entirely on your TAs so make sure you know what they're looking for.

I had her for a FIG leader first semester and she was so awesome. She was like a mother to us all and cared so much. Lynn gave such a spirited interpretation of all the lit & suggested books that we might like almost every day. I have no complaints about the woman. She is just a wonderful person and wants everyone to succeed. We still keep in touch

Great for small class discussion.  She really pushes you to think critically about the literature you are reading and will contest you on points if you are straying from the text.  That said, be prepared to do plenty of reading.

She is a little bit crazy a nd lectures are completely useless; she would often ramble  on about some far fetched analysis. Did minimal work and still got a good, basically it depends on your TA because he does all the grading.

Lots of reading and writing. Read 7 books, wrote two analytical essays, did a history report, and took two exams. Plus every week for discussion a response paper was due. Attendance was mandatory which I thought was kind of ridiculous, but other than that it was a good class.

This class is not very hard, however, there is a lot of reading. Professor Keller's lectures were pretty interesting as well as the subject of the class. If you get a good TA, you should do well in the class.

This is a relatively straightforward professor.  There is an extensive reading list, but many of the novels are fascinating. She gives fascinating interpretation of the lit in lecture, which, as some people have written, does sometimes sound similar to Spark Notes. Fair tests, which are graded by TAs anyways. Take for Comm B if possible.

Lots of novels to read but they interesting at least. At lot depends on your TA, if you get a easy TA you will do well. There are two essays, a historical report with presentation, and two exams including the final. They are all relatively easy, overall you should have no problem getting at least a B in this class.

Books are good, class is easy, short, and relatively painless. She wasn't the most fascinating prof, but I've had worse. She calls a few names at the beginning for attendance, gets upset if you leave early
Boring but very easy class! Her lectures sound like she is talking from spark notes...but very easy class that fulfills comm B requirements.

She's clear, articulate, and knowledgeable, but at times a little boring.  The class is easy, and if you like reading, you'll like it-the reading list is great.  My TA was fantastic...actually he was better than Prof. Keller...but I had a great time and got a great grade.  Overall, a good course.
shes pretty stupid but the class isnt hard as long as you read the books and attend discussion. she takes attendence in lecture but theyre useless
This class was one of the most boring I've ever taken.  She takes attendence during every lecture.  I do not recommend this class at all.
Expect at least 150 pages of reading per week.  She speaks quickly and writes nothing on the board, and has no Powerpoints.

I loved this class.  Prof Keller explained all of the readings really well, and discussion sessions were helpful.  All of the novels we read were really engaging and interesting.  Overall a great class to take!

Books were very interesting and as long as you go to all the lectures this class isn't too bad. She speaks fast and writes little on the board which is annoying. I did find it a little suspicious how often what she said was exactly what I found on Spark Notes. She also allows not extra time on tests which is a real downer since the tests are long.
Pretty good professor

A great graduate-level teacher: leads discussion effectively; challenges students rather than accepting every comment as equally valid; genuinely passionate about experimental poetry, and a great reader of it. A truly fine teacher. Clearly works hard at her scholarship and expects you to be equally committed, but that's only fair at this level.
No Comments
Her lectures are straight from sparknotes. Nothing interesting or original is ever said and She might be the worst English teach I have ever had. If you have her I would switch out immediately

I am currently taking her for Modern American Poetry and I think she's great.  You can tell she loves the stuff she's talking about, class is pretty much all discussion, she doesn't put down any comments you make in class ... not a terribly hard grader and a really nice lady

She doesn't read the books she teaches until she has to teach them. She assigns a big research paper early in the year. I got Agent Orange. We read 2 books on Nam at the end, and NOTHING about Agent Orange. She didn't even realize until I came up and asked what I should do. I got an A though.
This was my least favorite class that i took this semester... lectuer was terrible and unhelpful.
It seems like she is teaching from spark notes. Lecture is ridiculously boring. Only attend when assignments are due. TA's were ok, but didn't cover much that was on exams.

Worst class ever! The lectures were so boring and nothing interesting, thought-provoking, or helpful was said.  There is a lot of reading, but you don't need to do it. Overall the lecture is a complete waste of time!  Basically you can get just as much from sparknotes as you would from the lecture.
Prof. Keller is really great, she is articulate and really smart. She really cares about her students and is always there to help.
Extensive commenting on coursework.  She is very dedicated.
Really cares about students.  Great paper comments.
